no.motif.option

Class Optional<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.motif.option.Optional<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the wrapped object.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterable<V>, Mappable<V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Optional.None, Optional.Some

    public abstract class Optional<V>
extends Object
implements Iterable<V>, Mappable<V>, Serializable
    An Optional wraps a value that is either defined or undefined. Usually, undefined means null, and defined means an object instance, but the distinction between defined and undefined can be customized with a Predicate.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  Optional.None<V>
      Wrapper for an 'undefined' value.
      static class  Optional.Some<V>
      Wrapper for a 'defined' value.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        public static <V> Optional<V> resolve(Predicate<? super V> isPresent,
                      V value)

        *** Not part of the public API! ***

        Factory method for resolving a value to Optional.Some or Optional.None.
        See Also:
        Singular.optional(Object), Singular.optional(Predicate, Object), Singular.none()

      • get

        public final V get()
        Obtain the value contained in the Optional. To use this method one must first determine that the Optional does in fact hold a value. To obtain the wrapped value, it is in general preferable to favor iterating or using getOrElse(Object), which will never throw an exception.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - if this method is called on an Optional without a defined value.
        See Also:
        isSome()

      • map

        public abstract <O> Optional<O> map(Fn<? super V,O> mapper)
        Map this Optional to another type of Optional.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Mappable<V>
        Parameters:
        mapper - A function which transforms (or maps) the wrapped value to another value. This function will only ever be called if the Optional holds a defined value.
        Returns:
        A new Optional from which the new value can be obtained, if it is defined.

      • map

        public abstract <O> Optional<O> map(Predicate<? super O> isPresent,
                  Fn<? super V,O> transformer)
        Map this Optional to another type of Optional.
        See Also:
        map(Fn), resolve(Predicate, Object)

      • isSome

        public abstract boolean isSome()
        Returns:
        true if the Optional holds a defined value, or false otherwise, which usually means that the wrapped value is null.

      • getOrElse

        public abstract V getOrElse(V fallback)
        Parameters:
        fallback - A value to return if called on a Optional.None.
        Returns:
        The wrapped value, or the fallback value if it is undefined.

      • split

        public abstract <O> PreparedIterable<O> split(Fn<? super V,? extends Iterable<O>> splitter)
        Split an optional value, if defined, into multiple values.

        Due to limitations of the type system in Java, it is not possible to overload this method to accept both functions yielding an Iterable (as this method does) as well as functions yielding an array. It is recommended to prefer implementing functions yielding Iterables. If implementing an array-yielding function is most appropriate for your case, and you wish to use the function to split an optional value using this method, it is possible to adapt the function using Base.toIterable(Fn)

        Parameters:
        splitter - a function yielding an iterable.
        Returns:
        the elements, or empty iterable if undefined value.
